messages.title: DEMANDING BETTER FOR SUNDERLAND
messages.content: Paul Edgeworth is fighting to become the next MP for Houghton and Sunderland South at the General Election.

mentions.tacticalSituation: This election is a chance to kick out the current Labour MP and get a strong local Lib Dem MP who will stand up to Sunderland Council and will really fight in Parliament for jobs, investment and improvements for Sunderland.

issues.governance: Paul Edgeworth and Lib Dem councillors have campaigned to stop shameful wasteful spending by Labour-run Sunderland Council - such as inflated councillor allowances, all-you-can-eat buffet meals for councillors after meetings and extortionate pay-offs for senior staff.

quotes.text: We deserve better than a Labour MP who we never hear from.

This election is a chance to kick out the current Labour MP and get a strong local Lib Dem MP who will stand up to Sunderland Council and will really fight in Parliament for jobs, investment and improvements for Sunderland.

images.caption: Paul Edgeworth with the Penshaw Monument in the background.
Paul Edgeworth on a street in the constituency.
A silhouette of an unknown person with a question mark, symbolizing the current Labour MP.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Lifelong Labour supporters are turning their back on the party and are switching to the Liberal Democrats.
